website_summaries.verdict: This tent is lightweight and packs down small for easy carrying when you are backpacking.
pros: Can sleep a tall person comfortably
Guy lines are made of a reflective material to make them easier to see at night
cons: There are lighter backpacking tents available

customer_reviews.title: Amazing decision.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this tent. I bought it like two weeks before moving to Senegal through the Peace Corps. Regretfully I was emergency evacuated due to covid, BUT, while I was there I literally chose to sleep in my tent versus my bunk bed. This tent is great to sleep in without the rain cover and just sleep under the stars. It is extremely easy to put together and take apart and super durable. I couldn’t have made a better choice. I literally sent another tent back and ordered this last minute.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Tore after first use.
customer_reviews.text: I set this up in my house just to see if it would work for my camping trip. It tore. Returned it next day.
customer_reviews.author: Veracity

customer_reviews.title: Our netting ripped
customer_reviews.text: We used this tent three times in Iceland during late July (it was still freezing and I felt as if the tent wasn't insulated well enough, even though it was summer- around 40-50° F). Then the fourth time we used it in Hong Kong, we noticed two rips in the netting seam... My husband and I have no clue how it ripped as we were very carful setting it up and taking it down. Luckily, Amazon was kind enough to give us a refund even though the return policy had expired.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Weldon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tent for this newbie hiker/backpacker
customer_reviews.text: So far I am loving this tent. I'm a hiking/backpacking newbie and can't afford to spend too much on a tent right now, but I also want a quality product. I set this tent up in less than 5 minutes (including the rain fly). It looks to be pretty durable and high quality. After setting it up in my backyard, I kept it up for a few days, where it went through a pretty significant rain storm; the inside of the tent was dry the next morning. I'm going to take this tent on a few long, AT section hikes, so I may adjust this review based how it performs once I'm out on the trail.
customer_reviews.author: L. H.

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for two small people, but too cozy for two grown ups
customer_reviews.text: OK, I set up the tent upon receipt, but in the house not in the wild just to check on ease of putting it up and quality of the material. I'm 6'2" 200 lbs., so I don't really see this as a 2 person tent unless absolutely necessary. It would be fine for one with room to put your belongings inside. The zipper seems of decent quality and the polls look as good as those that came with my bigger tent. It's relatively light and could be carried while backpacking with no problem. Rain flap and rope included. TNH makes some nice affordable products and I am proud to add this tent to my "collection."
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for backpacking. Fits two people
customer_reviews.text: We recently tried this guy out on our backpacking trip in Shenandoah National Park. It rained the first night, nah actually it stormed. Like buckets of water. The rain cover left us mostly dry, a couple sprits of water (smaller than droplets) sprayed inside a tiny bit. So we purchased some water proofing spray. We also purchased the tent footprint from the manufacturer's website. Overall, great tent. Perfect size for two people. Light weight and small. Easy for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Ms.Zev

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for the perfect, lightweight tent to take around with me while I did some hiking in the summer. It took me forever to make a decision on a tent because I wanted to purchase the best one for the lowest price. When I found this one and watched the video explaining the benefits of the tent. I purchased it and glad I did. The tent is truly lightweight and durable. Easy, and I mean easy, to set up and take down. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: James Gibbons

customer_reviews.title: Amazing customer service
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had my tent for a few years, I throughly enjoy it though when camping with my SO, we prefer to use a two entrance tent. I plan to use this tent while solo camping in the next couple of weeks and could not find my tent poles. I reached out to the company to see how I could purchase a new set and they sent me them, no charge. I will definitely purchase more gear through them!
customer_reviews.author: Zukasaur

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is great, rain fly feels durable. Interior space is large, with multiple pockets on the sides for storage and multiple hooks overhead. Total weight is 4 pounds 7.2 ounces. Highly recommend, if your in the market for a two person tent. Reflective string is also a nice touch on both the aluminum stakes and to tie down the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as it appears.
customer_reviews.text: I set the tent up, packed it up and returned it. I am a 5'3" average build female. Sitting in the tent, my shoulders touched the sides. Even with staking out every loop, the tent was saggy and loose. There was nothing sturdy or taut. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: dollene ray

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for light weight, backpacking!
customer_reviews.text: A comparison without factoring price - I'll leave that decision to you. This tent is smaller and lighter than my Marmot Limelight 2P. With tent and rainfly the TNH weighs in at 63.6oz (Marmot is 87.5oz). The stakes and guylines add 7.4oz (not included w the Marmot). The TNH is slightly smaller (comfort for 1 adult or 1 adult and 1 child), and feels like it is less reinforced (e.g. slightly less rain protection, thinner stitching, lighter duty zippers, etc), but ultimately I think it will hold up fine. The TNH will be my choice for 1-man backpacking trip in fair weather. I'll use the Marmot if I expect more room is needed or worse weather is likely.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Needs bottom cover but great otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: Needs a bottom cover, but otherwise it's amazing for the price! Used this on a 14-day Hawaii trip. Plenty of rain without anything coming inside (mist when we were in the mountains did get in... I'm not an inexperienced camper so I'm not sure, but that seems like something you can't avoid without making the tent literally airtight.) Supposedly there is an accessory bottom cover in the offing. At that point this will be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I bought this tent
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I bought this tent.The tent is easy to set up, packs well enough, and I haven't noticed any problems with the quality. I like that the tent is long enough to fit me without problems and my over-length sleeping pad. I shared the tent with my nine year old and it worked well. I'm excited to do more backpacking trips with him, and I'm pretty confident that the tent will hold up well enough in the mountain weather.
customer_reviews.author: T. Needham

customer_reviews.title: Defective product.
customer_reviews.text: 1st tent was missing metal “O” ring on strap...tent would collapse when attaching rain fly. Returned, ordered another. 2nd tent’s zipper did not work. Strike two. I’m done. Would be a nice tent if they weren’t defective.
customer_reviews.author: Yogi Gobi Gage

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tent!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very small tent! It fits two people but thats it. Its really a great one person tent. Perfect for backpacking. I chose this rather than a bivy sack. Not a tall tent. I like that its discreet. Easy to set up!
customer_reviews.author: tina smith

customer_reviews.title: Best tent hands down
customer_reviews.text: TNH Outdoors has done it again. Another well thought out product. This tent sets up so easily with the single pole design. It takes 1 minute for 1 person or 30 seconds for 2 people. The tent includes pockets as well has a hanger for a light at the top. The sides keep the cold winds out while the upper mesh allows air exchange without sacrificing temperatures. I have used this tent a few dozen times and it is in just as good of shape as when I got it. Really looking forward to the 1 person tent coming out soon!
customer_reviews.author: MikO

customer_reviews.title: A well made tent!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased Raiakia's two person backpacking tent along with their dual chamber sleeping pad. I want to say that I was extremely excited at how well they both performed. I love how the tent has a one pole set up which means more simplicity and fewer things to lose. It's so easy and quick to set up, and I like how I can even do it by myself. Also, it's super lightweight and compactable for a two person tent and fits right into my backpack! Overall this is a great tent, I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Larizaloha

customer_reviews.title: Weighs 3.14 pounds and has a lot of room.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put up and take down has plenty of room and a large vestibule I am 6,1 and fit fine. Only weighs 3.14 pounds. Great price for other tents that are comparable you will pay 3 times as much. Have not camped in the rain with it yet
customer_reviews.author: Kelly17

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lightweight all-purpose tent
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent. Very easy to setup and for a 2-person tent, it was spacious inside. I took this tent out this past weekend for Boy Scout outing and I can tell you that I am highly impressed. Our first night it rained non-stop and this tent performed amazingly perfect. Nothing in my tent or under the vestibule got wet. The second night, the temperature dropped to 37F with strong winds, which for mid-April in Alabama is cold! The tent performed excellent in the wind and colder temperatures. I'd recommend this tent to anyone looking for a lightweight all-purpose 2-person tent.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Pritchard

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent sacrifices silly frills for ease of setup and durability. I take it camping alone and have it set up in minutes. The clever one pole design amazes me and I would never go back to the two pole design after using this tent. It's has kept me dry and warm through multiple high alltitude camping trips. I love this tent and am so impressed by the low price.
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: Great for short trips
customer_reviews.text: As a novice back packer, I really didn't want to spend hundreds of dollars on gear. This tent was a little larger than I was looking for but the weight is still good. The tub style bottom is great, but the material doesn't feel like it's going to be as water resistant as I would like. I'll use a foot print if I'm going to be in heavy rain. Set up is remarkably easy, had it up in under 4 minutes. Can't wait to try it in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy little tent
customer_reviews.text: Took this tent out camping and it snowed the first night. However that didn't ruin our experience because this tent held up and kept us dry. It fit perfectly our two air mattresses, and two pretty wide shouldered people with room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: J.L.T

customer_reviews.title: Decent tent.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a pretty decent tent. Good quality poles and material. I love the tie downs and stakes. A couple small things I could recommend: First, there should be something on the poles stating which end goes where because if you get the poles positioned wrong, you have to start over. Second, some instructions explaining where the different length tie downs go would be nice. Other than that, a very solid product.
customer_reviews.author: DaBlakesta

customer_reviews.title: Just straight garbage
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last summer for a trip to Alaska. Zipper failed on night 2. Tried fixing it several times with no success.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and lightweight 2-person tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is very lightweight and easy to setup. My children put it up in about 22 minutes having never seen it before. Watch the video review for the setup and more info. I have not yet gone camping with this tent but after setting it up it looks very well made and sturdy. I was a little worried about the length as I am 6-foot tall but I have plenty of room.
customer_reviews.author: A. Boggess

customer_reviews.title: Broken rainfly when opened out of package
customer_reviews.text: Zipper on rainfly door was broken when we were putting it up for the first time out of the bag. Looks like there is some serious quality control issues. My boyfriend and I we’re going out west for 3 weeks planning on camping. Not with a broken rain fly! Incredibly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and put together.
customer_reviews.text: Took this tremendously awesome tent out this weekend. Great trip, and equipment performed beyond expectations. Worked wonderfully to keep the wind out, and made a lightweight shelter to pack in to our camp location. Served its purpose admirably. I would highly recommend this product. Picture is from after I pulled out stakes and guy lines. Should have taken it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B

customer_reviews.title: All the products are really great quality. They have the feel and look of ...
customer_reviews.text: I often take my motorcycle on camping trips, so I wanted to buy something light and resistant. After a lot of research I came across TNH and bought almost the whole line. First I got the tent, sleeping bag and sleeping pad, and then the hammock. All the products are really great quality. They have the feel and look of high end camping gear, but at an affordable price. I'm extremely satisfied! Note: A few days after my purchase I received the hammock fly tarp as a courtesy, which I loved it too! TNH is all you want in a company: Great products, great price and marvelous customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Freakin' awesome tent
customer_reviews.text: My spouse and I took this tent to Tennessee and it POURED down rain on us for three nights in a row. We set up the tent in the back of an F150 truck and it fit perfectly and we did not get a drop of rain on us and slept well all night. I would recommend this to anyone looking to stay dry in a rainstorm. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Simple... Spacious.... Sustainable!
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to try this one out! Got it into the mountains right away. Set up is so quick and easy. Really like the single pole system. Lay it flat, stake it down, put the pole on the grommets then attach the clips on the tent to the poles.... You're done! Very spacious and even extra head room. Be sure to grab the sleeping pads and sleeping bag! I have the full system and they are great!
customer_reviews.author: CO_Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Durable 2 Person Tent & Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: So quick and easy to set up. Lovely green color. Perfect size. Mesh portion of tent very high quality. I have had $250 tents where the mesh felt like tissue paper. This tent is made with durable materials. Rakaia Designs customer service is fantastic as well. I ordered the tent and foot print and no stakes were in the package. I messaged them and the next day I received two orders of stakes. Also, they have a lifetime guarantee. Thank you so much for making quality gear and caring for your customers.
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: Great backpacking tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is very spacious. It can hold two average size adults and a dog comfortably. It is easy to assemble and take down and is quality made. It does add 4.14 lbs to your pack but well worth it. I highly recommend this tent.
customer_reviews.author: teresa salerno

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I'm really excited that TNH has finally released their two person tent. This is appears to be a solid tent for the money- inexpensive but made with quality materials. I haven't had a chance to test it out in the rain yet but I am confident it will keep me dry when I do. Pros: Complete rainfly coverage Taped stitching on floor 14 aluminum stakes Single Y-design aluminium pole Vent on the rain fly Vestibule to store gear Vestibule zipper protected from rain Solid components and stitching 2 inside pockets and 2 hooks from ceiling to hang lights Cons: none
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I love my TNH tent. It’s a solid product like all my TNH gear has always been. It’s light weight and looks like it will fit nicely in my hiking pack. The best part is the value! I’ve been looking for a tent for months at twice the price of this tent. I was so excited when TNH came out with a tent of their own for me to add to my collection. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Jrister24

customer_reviews.title: Found my lifetime tent.
customer_reviews.text: I just spent two weeks living in this tent. I had ample space for myself and my gear. This was by far the easiest tent I have ever set up. Taking it down and packing it up was just as easy. The price is right, it’s light as all heck, and totally comfortable. I have a feeling I won’t ever be buying another tent.
customer_reviews.author: tommy

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight tent.
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to sleep in my tent but set it up when I received it. I found it very easy to set up without having to refer to the instructions. It is most definitely a backpack tent that deserves 5 stars. The are only two drawbacks that I’ve noticed. The floor is made of the same light weight material as the rest of the tent. Add to that there is no footprint designed for this tent. I own TNH’s sleeping pad and love it. I’ve used it over well over 40 times with no complaints. If this tent holds up as well as my pad this tent is money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent.
customer_reviews.text: I use this not as a backpacking tent, but tent to use around the yard for a peaceful night sleep. It's a bit too heavy for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: htmldriver

customer_reviews.title: So easy!
customer_reviews.text: This tent!!!!! Easy to set up, and I mean easy, black to front, green to back, stake down, put fly on, clip into place, stake down, done! Seriously that simple. Went for an overnight the ease of use was awesome. Because it takes so little time to set up it saves you so much time to gather fire wood, set up camp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tent!
customer_reviews.text: I just received the new tent and was really impressed with quality and price. The tent was easy to setup, took me about 10 minutes. All of the seams were taped and the material is high quality (210T Polyester (Tent fly and sides), 210D Oxford Material (Tent Floor), 5000mm waterproofing, 7075 aluminium poles). It weighed in a little above 4lbs and packed down pretty tight. I am looking forward to taking the tent in the white mountains when the weather warms up a bit. I have several other TNH products and have been very happy with the company. The deliver good gear at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: RickB

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, but Fits Two Snugly
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Large enough to snugly fit two people, but breaks down small enough to be a lightweight backpacking tent. I also love that it is a single pole system - no sorting through multiple poles of various lengths to figure out where they all go. There was one spot on the door where the zipper got stuck a little, but after trimming the threads that were causing the problem, it seems to be better now. I have been very impressed with everything TNH puts out. So far I have 2 hammocks, 2 camping pillows, 3 sleeping mats, and now this tent. Their products are great and, for the price, they can't be beat!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: NOT Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This tent doesn't seem to have much in the way of QA. There was a tear in it and the seems were off. Also it was dirty when we opened it and had shoe prints on it. I would NOT recommend this tent!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't taken it officially camping yet but I did "camp" in the backyard. I'm comparing it to my old Kelty tent and it's leaps and bounds better. Easier to setup, breaths far better, & lighter weight. The only issue I had was with the zipper. It's not the best zipper but for a sub $100 tent it'll do. Other than my preference for the zipper it's a fantastic tent!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: More great gear from TNH
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of TNH gear, and I love all of it. This tent is no different! I bought this to replace another 2 person tent (see pictures). These are my initial impressions. I will update later once I've tried it out. TNH's tent is far lighter and more compact when packed up. It also comes with quality tent stakes. The pole for the tent is a single long pole that snaps together seamlessly (you literally have a hard time knowing where it snaps together). I will say the one downside is that there is no footprint for the tent, but I'm sure TNH will release one soon. When they do, I'm definitely getting it, too.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Good travel tent
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put up. Light. Good product for the price. In my 15 nights camping I didn’t get a hard rain but in the little I did get I stayed dry. The rain fly was quite soaked so it worries me a bit in a hard rain. Used the rain fly to block cold wind and it did a great job. Well worth the price for casual backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Clark

customer_reviews.title: First use thoughts
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, great price, and great find. Took it out for a 3 day backpacking trip and loved it. It was in the mid twenties at night and wouldn't want take it out any colder. No way to contain any heat especially at the front. The door of the tent is nothing but bug mesh and relying on the rain fly. Not a big deal and I like the design and will be using it again, just would have liked to have the capability to close it up a little bit at the front. I will update when I see how it does in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent backpacking tent
customer_reviews.text: It's compact and light, but is a true two person tent. Easy to set up and take down. Great to throw on a backpack, and I hope to use it for a long distance motorcycle trip soon. A great practical value for the money! Would give it five stars but I'm not a fan of the color. Olive or coyote brown please!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Crosby

customer_reviews.title: I bought this used at a nicely discounted rate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used at a nicely discounted rate. The tent is great, very roomy, easy to put up. It comes with no instructions but there are plenty of instructions online. One of the seams was ripped but I easily repaired it and it is just fine. I haven't encountered any inclement weather with it yet, that is the true test.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: It's really for 1.5 people
customer_reviews.text: Although the weight isn't too bad split between two people, there isn't much room for gear and two people once it's set up. If you can cover your gear outside of the tent, that's best. For the price, it's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Joel H

customer_reviews.title: Good buy though I feel the only reason I can't ...
customer_reviews.text: Good buy though I feel the only reason I can't give this 5 stars is that this may fit myself and another shorter person it's a bit on the smaller end. However I love the design of the back flap that gives more ventilation to the tent as well and the angle of the door to the outside it gives just enough room to put my shoes on the tarp.
customer_reviews.author: Maritza

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful tent
customer_reviews.text: TNH outdoors has a great customer support service and were in contact with me even when I decided to return the tent. Product came fast and as described. This is truly a 2 person tent and there is even some room left for gear. The tent is easy to set up, tough built and seamless are seal. I didn't have the opportunity to use it and decided to return it because it doesn't come with a footprint and more important, it's too heavy for a thru-hike. I would recommend this product for short hikes, or weekend camping. Also the design and color is beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Solid/value priced tent
customer_reviews.text: As a casual camper this two person tent hits the mark. Great price, reasonable weight, easy set up. It was surprisingly roomy inside ... two adults would be tight however that is common in any two person tent. I did watch tent video review on TNH website and took advice to seam seal rain fly. Recommend watching this video review. Very solid/value priced tent!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Curfman

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, Fast Setup and Takedown!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is perfectly sized for two people! It went up in under five minutes and takedown was about the same. It has two internal hooks on the ceiling to hang lanterns and also has two pockets in the front (one on each side). The stakes are very high quality and made of metal, much better than their normal plastic counterpart. Would recommend the ten to others
customer_reviews.author: Kaleb

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Warm and toasty for me and the pup. Spacious enough for both plus some. Kept the rain out for the most part however if the rain fly touches the side the water comes through. Will have to spray waterproof spray on it and hope that works.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Decker

customer_reviews.title: Great price, awesome tent
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, easy to setup, had no issues when camping in heavy rain, water tight.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great spring and summer tent
customer_reviews.text: Nice little tent. I received it yesterday, kids slept in it last night. Will be a very good spring and summer tent. Rain fly provides good coverage. Zippers could be a little stronger but overall the quality is very good. It's a little small to fit two big adults but one adult with kid is fine, two even 3 kids can work.
customer_reviews.author: K. S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Use for camping. Easy to set up & very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Chip369

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight. Perfect for backpacking. Hailstorm worthy!
customer_reviews.text: This was totally worth the buy! We were cozy in it during our backpacking trip in the Sawtooth mountains. We waited out a hardcore hailstorm in this for 12 hours and I was impressed! It packed down small and was super light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: Well I haven’t tested it in rain yet but it pops right up and seems to be well made. Intelligent design and quality materials. Smaller package and lighter weight than I predicted.
customer_reviews.author: ride

customer_reviews.title: Great weekend trip tent for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is perfect for a weekend getaway and is a breeze to set up and tear down. It rolls up very nicely into the included draw string bag and is comparatively smaller and lighter than similar tents. It's no $1000 extreme backpacking tent, but this will serve you very well on your next weekend excursion. The design is well thought out and it's very easy to put together with the permanently attached clips vice running a rod through fabric on the tent itself. This tent will fit two people and their gear although it will be a cozy fit.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Worth way more!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously blew my expectations out of the water! Very light weight and built very well!
customer_reviews.author: Philip Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: This tent is lightweight and simple to assemble. The floor seemed thinner than I expected even for a lightweight backpacking tent. You should definitely use a tarp or other footprint between the tent and ground. I appreciate the cinch sacks for the high-viz cord,14 stakes, and pole assembly as well as the included pole sleeve for emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: ScoutDad

customer_reviews.title: Love this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Hubby and I love our new backpacking tent. Was so easy to assemble. Super light to carry and we slept super cozy in it. Hubby is 6'2 I am 5'4 and we had plenty of room inside
customer_reviews.author: Holly Oquist

customer_reviews.title: Well Built, Easy to use backpacking tent
customer_reviews.text: All the components are well built, and assembly is a breeze. Tent has room for two, and the whole assembly is very light and easy to pack. Poles break down, and both the top cover, and inner tent fold up into a nicely packable tube. The tent comes with plenty of stakes to secure tent and cover, along with high visibility green cord for the tie offs. All together a tent that I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, great company
customer_reviews.text: This tent was incredibly easy to set up and is perfect for backpacking. The rain fly zipper failed on my second outing. I contacted TNH and they sent me a replacement. I’ll definitely look to TNH for my future outdoor needs.
customer_reviews.author: Pops

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is a great deal for a budget price. It's very easy to set up alone, and is very sturdy. At 5'10", there's plenty of room for me to sit up and spread out inside. There's two pockets inside of the tent to store items. The tent also has two hooks to hang lamps from on the inside. Overall, for it's price, I'm very pleased with this tent!
customer_reviews.author: Cullen Eberhardy

customer_reviews.title: Great value for backpacking!
customer_reviews.text: Took this backpacking with me a few times and most recently on a 13 mile trip onto the Sangre De Cristo Mountain range. Nice and light, love the layout of the tent (feet at the opening of tent), pockets on the inside, a hook to hang my candle lantern, etc. Really happy with it and I'll be using it plenty more!
customer_reviews.author: Travis Nickey

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite tent for backpacking! It’s by far the lightest one I have and is easy to set up with the one pole design. We took it winter camping last week and we’re left dry and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: Havent sepnt a night in it yet.. bought it for overnights on the river while kayaking.. seems like a quality unit
customer_reviews.author: Kevin long

customer_reviews.title: ripped with 1st use
customer_reviews.text: The tent ripped as soon as I tried to set it up on the back net. Otherwise it looked fine.
customer_reviews.author: dottiii

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved that the tent was super small and easy to set up! It took less than five minutes to set up. It’s perfect for backpacking and you can actually sit up in it. I definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Kirra schultz

customer_reviews.title: Its not too heavy and seems to be made with strong sturdy materials. This is the first tent I've seen ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet but i set it up and can say i'm very excited to. Its not too heavy and seems to be made with strong sturdy materials. This is the first tent I've seen that has all of the poles already connected. I set it up in my kitchen and will say it is bigger than I was expecting. Plenty of wiggle room for two.
customer_reviews.author: Cayton

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, not too many dollars
customer_reviews.text: Was just what I was expecting! I haven’t gotten to use it as much as I expected yet, but it seems durable and I’m happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, will not hold up! I received the item with poor seams and holes. I requested a replacement and the same issues were seen! FYI, the tag says MADE IN CHINA!!!!
customer_reviews.author: michael boothby

customer_reviews.title: 2 person tent
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, lightweight tent. Only used twice but a very good value for what we paid.
customer_reviews.author: SpecK

customer_reviews.title: Warning... this tent will pop up so quick, you’ll have to help others set theirs up.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is great, I was hesitant at first, but I just did a trip that had a bad thunderstorm with hard rain and wind, and the tent performed perfectly! Zero water intrusion even without spraying water repellent. Very impressed. The material is very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C.

customer_reviews.title: great tent
customer_reviews.text: water resistant and durable. wish it was a lighter weight
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Cheap zipper, otherwise solid
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up, nice stakes and guy lines, but I’m having a lot of trouble with the zipper. It’s only my second night using this tent and the zipper is already messed up (I’m trying to fix it, we’ll see).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tent
customer_reviews.text: Great weight to money ratio! Easy set up. Roomy for a backpacking tent
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Breithaupt

customer_reviews.title: TNH makes high quality budget gear. Great backpacking tent.
customer_reviews.text: I have a taken this tent backpacking 3 times this season. Have been in the rain twice with no leaks. The quality of this tent far exceeds the price. Really premium piece of gear. My one complaint is that there is no fitted footprint that allows for a pole/fly only set up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: light and easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Amazing tent, light and easy to setup. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Gordo

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and weight for motorcycle camping. The tent can be set up in about two minutes and is plenty roomy for one person.
customer_reviews.author: Plane Truth

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Took this camping with Cub Scouts this weekend. It was 28° and very windy overnight & the tent was great. Light to carry while hiking, really easy to set up, easy to pack back up. Really couldn't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Super easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Super easy setup. Plenty of room for 1 person and gear. 2 might be pretty cozy, but still doable. Packs small and light. Includes aluminum stakes and pre-cut guy lines for the rainfly. Great value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: S. Lane

customer_reviews.title: Easiest setup ever!
customer_reviews.text: Roomy, light, and easy to set up. Looking forward to using it this summer for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Yoga Mom

customer_reviews.title: Awful, cheap Zipper’s. Broke on first night.
customer_reviews.text: Both rain fly Zipper’s broke on my first camping trip with it. Very cheap. Returned. Otherwise I would love this tent. Everything else was great. Real shame they cheaped out on the Zipper’s.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: This is a great, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, lightweight, comfortable single person tent. Two people would be right on top of each other. Super easy to setup in no time. Not a huge fan of the stakes but those can easily be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: martin meyers

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Used on a winter camping trip. Set up easy.
customer_reviews.author: JamesL

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Went on my first backpacking trip with this tent at the end od December and it held up great!
customer_reviews.author: Hope McCormack

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy
customer_reviews.text: The tent was super easy to set up and light weight to carry. Everything I need in a backpacking tent for two!
customer_reviews.author: Becca Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to set up, spacious, and reflective. This tent from TNH Outdoors had everything I needed. More than satisfied with my purchase, and I will be coming back to them for my other camping needs!
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: I am an experienced camper, I’ve been remote camping ...
customer_reviews.text: I am an experienced camper, I’ve been remote camping for 15 years. It, is lightweight and easy to set up; qualitywise, it has not held up. The zipper broke after only two summer seasons of use.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Such an amazing tent! So easy to set up and quite roomy!
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Great Hiking Tent
customer_reviews.text: Light, Compact, Easy set up and roomy for 2 adults
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 15 minutes
customer_reviews.text: the poles while we were trying to put it together snapped the plastic wasn’t strong enough should come with some kind of guide
customer_reviews.author: Renes Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for the price. Everything is high quality and it fits two people perfectly. I will be testing it out this weekend.
customer_reviews.author: jared

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very nice two man tent. Using it for motorcycle camping. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Looks a little different than the photo but is a ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks a little different than the photo but is a lot more spacious than I imagined. My 6'3'' boyfriend is comfy too
customer_reviews.author: Sara R.

customer_reviews.title: Great small tent, easy to set up, quality not so great.
customer_reviews.text: The tent is super easy to set up, very roomy inside. The quality is ok, when I first put it up I noticed the opening on the rain fly had sowing marks up and down, but what made me give this tent a 3 is when I was closing the zipper on the fly it came off in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian Larrondo

product_meta.title: Rakaia Designs 2 Person Camping & Backpacking Tent with Carry Bag and Stakes - Portable Lightweight Easy Setup Hiking Tent
feature_bullets: "Within minutes of setting it up (which was simple as pie) as huge storm blew in. High winds, tropical downpour! This bad boy kept ALL the water out! I was incredibly impressed!!" ~ Shayna

⛺ SET UP IS EASY - Single aluminum pole structure makes the tent easy to set up and pack into one’s backpack. It comes with aluminum tent stakes and reflective rope to improve their visibility at night and increase the safety.

⛺ SPACIOUS AND LIGHTWEIGHT - This lightweight 2-person tent was designed for comfort, space, and convenience. It is a roomy tent with plenty of space for you and a family member or friend. When you are finished with your trip, you can simply place the tent components back into the carrying bag to easily pack up and transport.

⛺ GREAT FOR ALL OCCASIONS - Get the most out of your tent during the year! The aluminum poles and ventilation window allow you to utilize this tent for activities in the spring and summer. So, whether you need a tent for traveling, backpacking, hiking, festivals outdoors or whether you are headed out for a weekend camping trip with family and friends, this is an ideal tent to fit your needs.

⛺ STAY DRY IN STORMS - Rakaia Designs (TNH Outdoors) tent is made out of waterproof,durable, breathable and environmentally friendly material, providing a home-like sweet feeling and making the soul close to nature.

⛺LIFETIME WARRANTY - Rakaia Designs (TNH Outdoors) is here to make sure that you are satisfied with your purchase. If you are not, please contact us and we will reply with a solution in under 24 HOURS. We stand by our 99% Amazon feedback rating, and from replacement to refund we will make sure you are satisfied.
